intro: Alsodeia storckii, commonly known as the yellow star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its clustered, star-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its bulbs are an important part of its life cycle, storing nutrients for growth. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
